name: Hyatt Regency Monterey Hotel & Spa

reviews.text: This is the second time we have chosen to stay here due to the great service. Joe Manuguerra on reception has made our stay for us by looking after us a second time in as many years! He has done everything possible to make our stay special for us. The on site Italian restaurant is great, our waiter, Karl, was fantastic, service is great anyway, but when he learnt it was our honeymoon, he made the night extra special for us. Bar staff are also very friendly and helpful. All in all, a good resort withe great staff.
reviews.title: Nothing is too much trouble for the staff at this hotel...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great room, lovely decor, rooms are in blocks with two floors, ask for upper level then you wont here anybody jumping up and down all night, if you are near the freeway then you will here traffic all night, it never stops.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel, beautiful grounds.

reviews.text: Did not get charged for parking which is a bonus as most hotels charge for this which is a massive rip off !!!!!
reviews.title: Not As Luxurious As The Hyatt In Carmel

reviews.text: Knuckles bar and restaurant is really good and great food, the service and staff at the hotel were really good and helpful and very courteous, would stay there agin.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel but close to freeway

reviews.text: While in the area on business, we chose to stay at The Hyatt in Monterey and thought it would be a good choice since we enjoyed the Hyatt in Carmel so much. The location is right off of the highway and on a beautiful golf course. We asked for a room with a golf course view which was available. The lobby is pretty with a space for wine tasting and the check-in staff was courteous and helpful.
reviews.title: Disappointing for the price

reviews.text: nice and modern room with great bathroom and great shower.
reviews.title: nice room, but a few issues and not so good customer service

reviews.text: well located about 2 miles from fisherman's wharf.
reviews.title: No dresser drawers? Really?

reviews.text: but..... also right next to highway - so if your room faces the parking lot, and you open the window, you will just have highway car/traffic noise. which sucks, especially if your AC doesn't work (like my room).
reviews.title: Nice but pricey

reviews.text: also, i was part of a big conference there, and asked for a late check out. best they would do was 30 minutes, and the desk clerk didn't even seem apologetic about it. really? at least make me feel like you tried. especially when the conference basically booked out the entire hotel for the week. so, disappointed with that.
reviews.title: A Major Disappointment

reviews.text: so, with those issues, i would have to give it a below average rating, especially for $200/night.
reviews.title: awful reservations customer service...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent five nights here and wished we hadn't. The only positive thing I can say is that the staff are all friendly people and try to be helpful, with what they have to work with - which frankly isn't much.
reviews.title: What a dump! Possibly the worst Hyatt Regency ever.

reviews.text: This hotel is nothing like the pro photos indicate. Time was when the Hyatt Regency brand meant a luxurious 4-star you could rely on. Not here. This place has a reception building that is fairly OK, but all the accommodation is in wooden bunkhouses, basically shacks which remind me of some sort of youth camp or worse. The one we were in had no elevator but was linked to another building by a walkway, so every time we entered we had to walk to the other one to go up or down. These places are very old and very worn. The elevator had a carpet which stank of old beer and who knows what else. There is no modern aircon, or anything else.
reviews.title: Beautiful location but rooms need A/C!

reviews.text: The restaurant is very limited, and I am being kind here. The place was full of people sent there on seminars, mixed with a few families with kids who were allowed to scream and shout at the pool until midnight.
reviews.title: After a rough start, the stay was much better...

reviews.text: The location is convenient for the freeway, or a round of golf, nothing else. Its miles from downtown Monterey or Cannery Row or Carmel. And it wasn't at a giveaway price either.
reviews.title: 70’s Décor - Not your usual Hyatt

reviews.text: All in all I cannot find anything to recommend going to this place. I have stayed in many Hyatts; this is by far the worst. I shall now view future Hyatts with deep suspicion.
reviews.title: A good stay

reviews.text: We used hotel.com to book our rooms x 3. Upon arrival we found out no reservation. After 45 mins of the attendant trying to find our reservation and saying our name and confirmation # everytime we were told no reservations. Finally he got the manager and we provided proof that we had paid 900 dollars for 3 rooms 1 night each. Finally they found us a room. We were none to happy. Then we are told after questioning the extra 90 dollars hotel.com charged that we would have to address with them as they sell them the rooms. We advised this is not the sale purchase price but an email confirmation that was sent later that day with final total. Mind you this was not the additional 20 per room resort fee. It was real funny how after all the drama to find the room the clerk said under his breathe for incidentals and resort fees as low as possible even though we were aware of the fees and were nice all along. Rooms were Ok. Not good not bad a place to rest you head.
reviews.title: Do not use Hotel.Com when Booking

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: used Priceline and scored big time! this place was lovely-- great spa, husband loved the golf course, fine italian restaurant and also nice lounge. Used this as a base for drive to Big Sur and afternoon in Carmel. Do have to drive to Aquarium, but we would be happy to return
reviews.title: got a great deal and loved this place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The first impression you get once you arrive at this hotel is: WOW!
reviews.title: Nice Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The ground are extremely gourgeus!
reviews.title: Sometimes.....

reviews.text: They have a beautiful golf course, and everything looks absolutely beautiful.
reviews.title: Tired rooms/Great staff

aka: Hyatt Regency Monterey Hotel And Spa
description: With 550 deluxe guest rooms and over 40,000 square feet of elegant function space, the Hyatt Regency Monterey Hotel and Spa is the most complete hotel destination on the Monterey Peninsula. Featuring fully renovated guestrooms and suites, a stylishly refurbished restaurant, the full service Accista Spa, redesigned front desk area, and lush, freshly landscaped grounds throughout, Hyatt Regency Monterey Hotel & Spa offers upscale surroundings and the luxury of a perfectly secluded setting. The rustic elegance and warmth of the property offers world-class amenities including golf, a full service tennis facility, two outdoor swimming pools, two whirlpools, a 12,000 square foot full service spa and salon, a state-of-the-art health club and our new Regency Club lounge. Strategically positioned adjacent to the championship Del Monte Golf Course, and 1/2 mile from the Monterey Bay, the Hotel is situated on 22 prime coastal acres just minutes from Cannery Row, Fisherman's Wharf, The Monterey Bay Aquarium, Carmel-by-the-Sea and Pebble Beach.
